thread.title: Rebels picked ninth, Moody an SEC first-teamer
thread.title_full: Rebels picked ninth, Moody an SEC first-teamer

title: Rebels picked ninth, Moody an SEC first-teamer
text:
Rebels picked ninth, Moody an SEC first-teamer Daniel Paulling, The Clarion-Ledger 10:22 a.m. CDT October 21, 2015 Ole Miss was picked ninth in the SEC media preseason poll. (Photo: John David Mercer, John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 8 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
OXFORD — The Ole Miss men’s basketball team was picked to finish ninth in the Southeastern Conference’s preseason media poll, as chosen by SEC and national media members. 
Kentucky was picked for the 11th time since 1998-99 season to win the SEC. Vanderbilt, Texas A&M, LSU and Georgia rounded out the top five. 
Rebels guard Stefan Moody was named first team All-SEC, joining Texas A&M’s Danuel House, Vanderbilt’s Damian Jones, Kentucky’s Skal Labissiere, LSU’s Ben Simmons and Kentucky’s Tyler Ulis. Simmons was also chosen as the preseason player of the year. 
The Rebels finished last season 21-13 after losing to Xavier in the second round of the NCAA tournament. They host Clayton State for an exhibition on Nov. 5 and open the season Nov. 13 at home against Northwestern State. 
First Team All-SEC 
Danuel House – Texas A&M, G, 6-7, 212, Sr., Fresno, Texas 
Damian Jones – Vanderbilt, C, 7-0, 245, Jr., Baton Rouge, La. 
Skal Labissiere – Kentucky, F, 6-11, 225, Fr., Port-au-Prince, Haiti 
Stefan Moody – Ole Miss, G, 5-10, 179, Sr., Kissimmee, Fla. 
Ben Simmons – LSU, F, 6-10, 225, Fr., Melbourne, Australia 
Tyler Ulis – Kentucky, G, 5-9, 160, So., Lima, Ohio 
Second Team All-SEC 
Dorian Finney-Smith – Florida, F, 6-8, 220, Sr., Portsmouth, Va. 
Malik Newman – Mississippi State, G, 6-3, 178, Fr., Jackson, Miss. 
Charles Mann – Georgia, G, 6-5, 215, Sr., Alpharetta, Ga. 
Alex Poythress – Kentucky, F, 6-8, 230, Sr., Clarksville, Tenn. 
Tim Quarterman – LSU, G, 6-6, 190, Jr., Savannah, Ga. 
Alex Caruso – Texas A&M, G, 6-5, 186, Sr., College Station, Texas 
Preseason poll
